What are the benefits of solo mining with Verus, and how can I get started with solo mining using Verus Agama wallet?

Solo mining with Verus is an excellent way to participate in the distributed securing of the Verus blockchain while earning rewards. While pool mining is also a viable option, solo mining offers the flexibility to mine independently and potentially earn rewards sooner and more regularly. Moreover, with Verus, you can split your computer power to mine solo and pool simultaneously, giving you the best of both worlds.

To get started with solo mining using Verus Agama wallet, you can follow a step-by-step guide that covers the process of CPU solo mining Verus Coin (VRSC) on your computer. This guide will walk you through the process of setting up your Agama wallet, configuring your mining software, and starting to mine VRSC using your CPU power. Additionally, you can also use a combination of CPU and GPU power to increase your mining capabilities.

Some benefits of solo mining with Verus include:

* Earning VRSC rewards for securing the Verus blockchain
* Participating in the distributed network and contributing to the security of the blockchain
* Flexibility to mine solo or pool, or both simultaneously
* Opportunity to earn rewards sooner and more regularly than pool mining

After getting started with solo mining, you can also join the Verus Community and participate in the active Discord channel. The Verus community is a 100% community-driven project, and the Discord channel is an excellent resource for getting help, finding ways to contribute, and earning more Verus coins.

Part 4 — Optional: Become a ‘Hans Solo’…Miner That Is!
Pool mining is a great way to participate in the distributed securing of a blockchain while earning rewards often sooner and more regularly than “solo mining”. Whether solo or pool mining however, ultimately the results should be about the same as far as coins earned.
Solo Mining doesn’t have to be “solo” either! You can split your computer power, mining solo AND pool simultaneously. Whether using just CPU power, or a combination of CPU and GPU, running the pool miner and Agama side by side is no problem!
